Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant with water and show it is healthy, using visual cues such as green leaves and standing upright.
The student can draw a plant without water and depict it as unhealthy, with wilted and drooping leaves.
The student can include sunlight in the drawing to indicate that plants also need light to live and grow.
The student may attempt to compare and identify differences between the plant with water and the plant without, noting changes in appearance due to lack of water.
CANNOT: The student might forget to label the drawings clearly or might incorrectly label the healthy and unhealthy plants (e.g., labeling the wilted plant as 'healthy').
The student might not show the need for water in animals or may inconsistently demonstrate this understanding (e.g., may only draw some animals drinking water or omit this part entirely).
